questions.question_text_1: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option.  Statement 1: If an element is styled externally using two different classes and an ID, then for the same attribute, it will always acquire styling from the latest style in order. Statement 2: If an element is styled internally using ID and class selector as well as using inline styling for the same style attribute, then it will acquire styling from the ID selector.
question_texts: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option.  Statement 1: If an element is styled externally using two different classes and an ID, then for the same attribute, it will always acquire styling from the latest style in order. Statement 2: If an element is styled internally using ID and class selector as well as using inline styling for the same style attribute, then it will acquire styling from the ID selector.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is incorrect
Statement 2 is correct but statement 1 is incorrect

props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with a **Mermaid knowledge graph** to visualize relationships. --- --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Web Development Fundamentals** #### **1.1 URL Structure** - **Components**: - **Protocol**: `https`, `http`, `ftp` - **Domain**: `onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in` - **Subdomain**: `seek.onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in` (if applicable) - **Path**: `/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003` - **Query Parameters**: `?type=lesson&tab=courses` - **Key Takeaway**: - Correctly identify components in a URL (e.g., `seek` is **not** a subdomain in the given example; `onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in` is the domain). #### **1.2 HTTP Requests & `curl`** - **Purpose of `curl`**: Command-line tool for making HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE). - **Example**: ```bash curl http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1 -X GET -d '{"movie": "X-men"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" ``` #### **1.3 HTML/CSS** - **Box Model**: - **Components**: Content → Padding → Border → Margin. - **CSS Syntax**: ```css #box { width: 200px; height: 20px; padding: 8px 4px; border: 3px solid; margin: 5px 10px; } ``` - **Form Validation**: - `:valid`/`invalid` pseudo-classes for input fields. - Example: ```html ``` #### **1.4 CSS Specificity & Inheritance** - **Specificity Hierarchy** (Highest to Lowest): 1. `!important` 2. Inline styles (`style="..."`) 3. IDs (`#id`) 4. Classes (`.class`), Attributes (`[type="text"]`), Pseudo-classes (`:hover`) 5. Elements (`div`, `p`), Pseudo-elements (`::before`) - **Key Takeaway**: - Inline styles **override** ID/class selectors. - Later styles **do not** automatically override earlier ones unless specificity is higher. --- ### **2. Python for Web Development** #### **2.1 Flask & Jinja2** - **Flask Routes**: ```python @app.route('/home/') def course(url_path): return f'The path is: {url_path}' ``` - **Jinja2 Templating**: - **Inheritance**: Base template (`base.html`) extended by child templates. - **Example**: ```html {% block head %}{% endblock %} {% block content %}{% endblock %} {% extends "base.html" %} {% block content %}

Hello, World!

{% endblock %} ``` - **Database Integration (SQLAlchemy)**: - **Model Definition**: ```python class Material(db.Model): m_id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(100), unique=True) ``` - **CRUD Operations**: ```python material = Material(name="Steel") db.session.add(material) db.session.commit() ``` #### **2.2 Web Components** - **Custom HTML Elements**: - Use `class` extending `HTMLElement`. - Example: ```javascript class MyElement extends HTMLElement { connectedCallback() { this.innerHTML = `

Hello, World!

`; } } customElements.define('my-element', MyElement); ``` #### **2.3 Data Persistence** - **Methods**: - **Databases** (SQLite, PostgreSQL) via ORMs (SQLAlchemy). - **Files** (JSON, CSV) for temporary storage. - **Cache** (Redis) for volatile data. --- ### **3. Testing & Debugging** #### **3.1 Pytest** - **Basic Syntax**: ```python def test_addition(): assert 1 + 1 == 2 ``` - **Markers & Selection**: - Run specific tests: ```bash pytest -m "marker1" # Runs tests with @pytest.mark.marker1 pytest -k "TestClass" # Runs tests with "TestClass" in name ``` - **Fixtures**: ```python @pytest.fixture def sample_data(): return [1, 2, 3] ``` #### **3.2 Test Coverage** - **Branch vs. Condition Coverage**: - **Branch Coverage**: All possible outcomes of decisions (if/else) are tested. - **Condition Coverage**: All atomic conditions (e.g., `x > 0 && y < 10`) are tested. - **Key Takeaway**: - 100% branch coverage **does not** imply 100% condition coverage (and vice versa). --- ### **4. Version Control (Git)** - **Configuration**: ```bash git config --global user.email "new-email@example.com" ``` - **Basic Commands**: ```bash git add . git commit -m "Message" git push origin main ``` --- ### **5. Networking Basics** #### **5.1 IPv4 to Hexadecimal** - **Conversion**: - `172.16.254.10` → `AC.10.FE.0A` - Break each octet into hex: - `172` → `AC` - `16` → `10` - `254` → `FE` - `10` → `0A` #### **5.2 Round-Trip Time (RTT)** - **Formula**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times \text{Distance} \times 1000 \text{ (convert km to m)}}{3 \times 10^8 \text{ m/s}} \times 1000 \text{ (convert to ms)} \] - **Example** (Server B at 900 km): \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 900 \times 1000}{3 \times 10^8} \times 1000 = 6 \text{ ms} \] #### **5.3 Request Rate Limiting** - **Maximum Requests to Server B**: - Depends on **RTT** and **dependency chain** (A → B → C). - Example: If RTT for B is 6 ms, max requests ≈ `1000 / 6 ≈ 166` (but constrained by dependencies). --- ### **6. RESTful APIs (Flask-RESTful)** - **Resource Definition**: ```python class TestAPI(Resource): def get(self): args = parser.parse_args() return {"movie": args["movie"]} api.add_resource(TestAPI, "/api/v1") ``` - **Request Parsing**: ```python parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument("movie") parser.add_argument("genre") ``` - **Marshalling (Response Formatting)**: ```python r_fields = {"film": fields.String(attribute="movie")} @marshal_with(r_fields) def put(self): return parser.parse_args() ``` --- ### **7. Modern JavaScript (Web Components)** - **Custom Elements**: ```javascript class MyComponent extends HTMLElement { connectedCallback() { this.innerHTML = `

Custom Element

`; } } customElements.define("my-component", MyComponent); ``` - **Shadow DOM**: - Encapsulates styles/scripts for a component. --- ## **Mermaid Knowledge Graph** ```mermaid graph TD %% Web Development Fundamentals WebDev[Web Development] --> URL[URL Structure] WebDev --> HTTP[HTTP/cURL] WebDev --> HTMLCSS[HTML/CSS] WebDev --> BoxModel[Box Model] WebDev --> Specificity[CSS Specificity] %% Python for Web PythonWeb[Python for Web] --> Flask[Flask Framework] PythonWeb --> Jinja2[Jinja2 Templating] PythonWeb --> SQLAlchemy[SQLAlchemy ORM] PythonWeb --> WebComponents[Web Components] %% Testing Testing[Testing] --> Pytest[Pytest] Testing --> Coverage[Branch vs. Condition Coverage] Testing --> Fixtures[Fixtures] %% Version Control Git[Version Control] --> Config[git config] Git --> Commands[Basic Commands] %% Networking Networking[Networking] --> IPv4[IPv4 to Hex] Networking --> RTT[Round-Trip Time] Networking --> RateLimiting[Request Rate Limiting] %% RESTful APIs APIs[RESTful APIs] --> FlaskRESTful[Flask-RESTful] APIs --> RequestParsing[Request Parsing] APIs --> Marshalling[Response Marshalling] %% Modern JS ModernJS[Modern JavaScript] --> CustomElements[Custom Elements] ModernJS --> ShadowDOM[Shadow DOM] %% Connections Flask --> Jinja2 Flask --> SQLAlchemy Pytest --> Coverage Networking --> RTT RTT --> RateLimiting ``` ```mermaid graph TD %% Dependency Graph for Key Concepts URL --> Protocol[Protocol: https] URL --> Domain[Domain: onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in] URL --> Path[Path: /courses/...] URL --> QueryParams[Query Parameters: ?key=value] Flask --> Routes[Routes: @app.route] Flask --> Templates[Jinja2 Templates] Flask --> Database[SQLAlchemy Models] Pytest --> TestSelection[Test Selection: -k, -m] Pytest --> Assertions[Assertions: assert x == y] Git --> GlobalConfig[Global Config: --global] Git --> LocalConfig[Local Config: No Flag] Networking --> Distance[Distance: km] Networking --> SpeedOfLight[Speed of Light: 3e8 m/s] Networking --> RTTCalc[RTT Calculation] ``` --- ## **Key Equations (Networking)** 1. **Round-Trip Time (RTT)**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times \text{Distance (m)} \times 1000}{3 \times 10^8 \text{ m/s}} \times 1000 \text{ (ms)} \] - Example (900 km): \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 900 \times 1000}{3 \times 10^8} \times 1000 = 6 \text{ ms} \] 2. **Maximum Requests per Second**: \[ \text{Max Requests} = \frac{1000 \text{ ms}}{RTT \text{ (ms)}} \] - For RTT = 6 ms: \[ \text{Max Requests} = \frac{1000}{6} \approx 166 \] - **But** with dependencies (A → B → C), the actual rate is lower (e.g., 56 requests/s).
